'''''[[McGear]]''''' -- [[Mike McGear]] | A [[Wings (band)|Wings]] album featuring Paul McCartney's brother Michael (then known as [[Mike McCartney|Mike McGear]] of [[The Scaffold]]) on lead vocals "Weep For Love", were performed by Wings, with Laine on lead vocals. |- |align="center"|1981 | '''''[[Concerts for the People of Kampuchea (album and EP)|Concerts for the People of Kampuchea]]''''' | A live album recorded at the Hammersmith Odeon, London in December 1979 to benefit Cambodian refugees, the album includes three songs performed by Wings and three songs performed by [[Rockestra Theme|Rockestra]]. |- | align="center"|1982 | '''''Straight Time''''' -- [[Laurence Juber]] | The song "Maisie" is performed by Wings. |- | align="center"|1998 | '''''[[Wide Prairie]]''''' -- [[Linda McCartney]] | Eight of the tracks featured different versions of Wings, including two that were originally attributed to [[Suzy and the Red Stripes]], "Seaside Woman" and "B-Side to Seaside". |- |}
